text: Halim Abdul Messieh El-Dabh ( (Ḥalīm ʻAbd al-Masīḥ al-Ḍabʻ); March 4, 1921 - September 2, 2017) was an Egyptian-born American composer, performer, ethnomusicologist, and educator. He has a career spanning six decades. He is known as an early pioneer of electronic music, for having composed in 1944 the first piece of electronic tape music. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:1921 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Egyptian writers Category:American composers Category:Educators from Ohio Category:Writers from Ohio Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Educators from New Jersey
title: Halim El-Dabh
